text: if you look at discover our North Stars
really our customer making sure that
we're doing the right thing by our
customers and the regulatory
requirements our compliance requirements
all help us achieve that goal but how
quickly we get there starts to become a
differentiator and that's where the
partnership between discover and AWS has
been really powerful but there's been a
huge investment in analytics and big
data at discovers that we have a lot of
information a lot of data a lot of
insight about our customers and we
should be able to turn that around to
give them a better experiences when we
looked at the landscape of all the
analytics tools and platforms across
discover were quite varied and we
thought about how do we get everybody
collaborating that's where air and I
came out we created an environment with
AWS help where we can create custom
environments for data scientists when we
first built out the air 9 data workbench
we knew we needed a shared storage
capability if you have all these
different environments running there
needs to be a common way to save data
and to collaborate and we built that our
own open-source storage system this
became very expensive very time
intensive as far as managing it and
running it EFS has been just a godsend
as far as making it so much more simple
to manage and to keep up and running day
in and day out it used to take a team of
five to six people focusing full-time on
storage and now we turn that over to EFS
and we have one person who maybe checks
it once a week
it just works for us it scales when we
need it to and most importantly it's
helped our data scientists collaborate
we've made some real helpful insights
about how our customers want to use our
products from the mobile application to
the website we've also seen a number of
big strides in the fraud area so
leveraging some new techniques around
how we understand fraud and how we
organize information related to fraud to
help us protect our customers more
effectively it's really been a
partnership and a conversation about how
we add value to our customers through
the cloud an AWS has been critical to
making sure that we can do that
